18 from ...common.io_objects import PinMode, NiryoIO
19 
20 
21 class FakeDigitalIO(NiryoIO):
22 
23  def __init__(self, name, mode):
24  super(FakeDigitalIO, self).__init__(None, None, name)
25 
26  assert mode in [PinMode.DIGITAL_OUTPUT, PinMode.DIGITAL_INPUT], \
27  "The pin mode of a fake digital io must be either PinMode.ANALOG_INPUT or PinMode.ANALOG_OUTPUT"
28 
29  self._mode = mode
30  self._value = 0
31 
32  @property
33  def value(self):
34  return self._value
35 
36  @value.setter
37  def value(self, value):
38  assert isinstance(value, (bool, int, float))
39  limited_value = max(0, min(int(value), 1))
40  self._value = limited_value
41 
42 
43 class FakeAnalogIO(NiryoIO):
44 
45  def __init__(self, name, mode):
46  super(FakeAnalogIO, self).__init__(None, None, name)
47 
48  assert mode in [PinMode.ANALOG_INPUT, PinMode.ANALOG_OUTPUT], \
49  "The pin mode of a fake analog io must be either PinMode.ANALOG_INPUT or PinMode.ANALOG_OUTPUT"
50 
51  self._mode = mode
52  self._value = 0
53 
54  @property
55  def value(self):
56  return self._value
57 
58  @value.setter
59  def value(self, value):
60  assert isinstance(value, (bool, int, float))
61  self._value = value
